Solve graphically the LPP: Maximize Z = 3x + 2y subject to x + y ≤ 8, x + 3y ≤ 12, x, y ≥ 0.
Formulate and solve the LPP for maximizing profit in producing two products A and B where constraints are given by resources availability.
An LPP is given by Maximize Z = 4x + 3y, subject to 2x + y ≤ 8, x + 2y ≤ 8, x, y ≥ 0. Solve graphically and find Zmax.

A factory produces two items using machines M1 and M2. Machine M1 takes 2h and M2 takes 3h for item A, while for item B, M1 takes 3h and M2 takes 2h. If M1 and M2 work 8h each, form and solve the LPP to maximize production.

A factory produces two items using machines M1 and M2. Machine M1 takes 2h and M2 takes 3h for item A, while for item B, M1 takes 3h and M2 takes 2h. If M1 and M2 work 8h each, form and solve the LPP to maximize production.
Formulate an LPP to minimize cost subject to given constraints of production and resource utilization, then solve graphically.
Solve graphically the LPP: Maximize Z = 3x + 2y subject to x + y ≤ 8, x + 3y ≤ 12, x, y ≥ 0.
